definition: 11 am-1 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
surname Shi

sentences.english: Noon because of the "Chen-yang", so end of the five also called the "Dragon Boat Festival.
sentences.chinese: 又因午時爲“陽辰”，所以端五也叫“端陽”。

sentences.english: The workers quit work at noon.
sentences.chinese: 工人在中午時停止工作。

sentences.english: At noon the men came to shore for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 在中午時，河工們開始在岸邊喫午飯。

sentences.english: Most bringing fruits, when afternoon eats a spot.
sentences.chinese: 最多自帶水果，在下午時喫一點。

sentences.english: At noon we ate a meal.
sentences.chinese: 中午時本人們吃了一頓飯。

sentences.english: Doctors at noon herbs, traditionally the stars overhead medicine days.
sentences.chinese: 醫家則於午時採藥，相傳此日天醫星臨空。

sentences.english: In the afternoon, we play basketball or tennis.
sentences.chinese: 下午時，我們打籃球或者網球。

sentences.english: There midnights all a glimmer, and noon a purple glow.
sentences.chinese: 半夜裏微光幽幽，中午時紫光熠熠。

sentences.english: Stansfield says he and his goons will show up at noon.
sentences.chinese: 史丹斯菲爾德說要帶着他那夥人正午時出現。

sentences.english: The sun was midway across the sky when I noticed how restless Maheegun had become.
sentences.chinese: 太陽正當午時，我突然注意到美爾根躁動不安。

sentences.english: At noon he went to eat at a small Western-style restaurant in the neighborhood, afraid to speak to anybody.
sentences.chinese: 午時一個人到鄰近小西菜館裏去飯，怕跟人談話。

sentences.english: We passed slowly down the hill in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午時我們慢慢向山下移動。

sentences.english: Around noon, things got quiet on the New York floor, and I got overly drowsy.
sentences.chinese: 中午時，紐約交易廳那邊變得相當安靜，我又非常困。

sentences.english: Announcements, updates, is said to ward off evil spraying noon.
sentences.chinese: 說是午時噴灑雄黃酒是避邪。

sentences.english: Morning-glories upfold their flowers by noon.
sentences.chinese: 牽牛花在中午時就合上了。
